intro: Syagrus chiragua, commonly known as the palm tree of the Brazilian Atlantic Forest, is a flowering plant belonging to the Arecaceae family. It is a tall, slender palm that can reach heights of up to 20 meters, with a smooth, unbranched trunk and a crown of pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in branched inflorescences, followed by dark blue, spherical berries. Syagrus chiragua is adapted to humid, tropical climates and is often found in coastal areas with well-drained soils. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various wildlife species in its native range.
